abstract.t: This document defines a protocol for provisioning session establishment data into Session Data Registries or SIP Service Provider data stores. The provisioned data may then be used by various network elements for session peering. This document focuses on the Session Peering Provisioning Protocol used by clients to provision registries. The document provides a set of guiding principles for the design of this protocol like extensibility and independent transport definitions, a basic data model that meets some of the requirements discussed in DRINKS and an early XML Schema Document.
